description.narrative: UNDP/Kaidi Project “Sustainable Biomass Sourcing Model for Bioenergy Development in China”

participating-org.narrative: Kaidi Ecological and Environmental Technology Co., Ltd.

activity-description.narrative: establish a replicable model of sustainable biomass sourcing for bio-energy development in Guangxi and eventually across China

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

provider-org.narrative: Kaidi Ecological and Environmental Technology Co., Ltd.

description.narrative: - Report by the Pre-conditional Feasibility Study - Chongzuo’s Comprehensive Plan for Promoting Modern and Environment-Friendly Agriculture, Forestry, Husbandry Development (2015-2025) - Comprehensive Development Plan for Non-Grain Biomass Energy Industry of Chongzuo, Guangxi (2015-2025) - Design and Plan for Sustainable Industry Chain of Using agro/forestry Biomass Resources in key pilot areas - Baseline survey concluded. - One training center set up for the purpose. - Number of training courses conducted. - Number of farmers’ field school set up - Number and type of training packages developed - Number of people trained and % of people trained with increased knowledge and skills - Number of participants in community - Develop 1 standardization of sugarcane mechanized operation - Number of machinery procured - Number of service units set up - Domestic and international study tours completed - Prototype developed and tested - Report on adaptability and economics for dissemination - Partnership set up - Feasibility study completed - Demo set up - Demo for production and refining of biogas from sewage treatment for production of compressed natural gas (CNG); - Demo for recycling of treated sewage for sugarcane irrigation; and - Demo for production of organic fertilizers with wastes from the sugar milling process - Eucalyptus demonstration plantations identified/set up as sustainable forest biomass sources - Energy grass-planting models set up by use of marginal lands - Pilot high-yield cassava farming set up - PSC, LG, PMOs set up - Staff in place - Detailed work plans developed - Planned activities take place - Advocacy and communication strategy developed and implemented - Mid-term evaluation report - Final evaluation report - UNV recruited - UNV reports reviewed

comment.narrative: - Establishment of Modern Agricultural Training Centre for providing technical trainings to farmers on sugarcane production - Facilitate the establishment of Farmers Field School to provide technical trainings to farmers on high-yield crop farming, production management and pest management, etc. - Standardisation of sugarcane mechanised operation - Promotion of mechanised farming operation services - Feasibility study on combining harvesting and juicing operations - To establish Guangxi biomass energy collection and storage mechanism and compile Research Report of Establishment on Guangxi Biomass Energy Collection and Storage Mechanism - Conduct mid term review

Over the course of Jan to Dec 2018, on the basis of previous work, the project has achieved certain results. However, due to the severe unavailable funds, the advancement of project is not in progress as expected, except for the activities scheduled at the end of the previous year, namely local capacity development training, agricultural machinery utilisation, energy forest and grass plantation, and delegation to competent authorities and enterprises in Australia and Japan learning expertise in biomass energy industry. Although the PMO has done numerous preliminary feasibility research and visits for the construction of the biomass collection-storage-transportation system, capacity development workshop for Vietnamese cross-border migrant labours and further promotion of the local agricultural modernization, few activities have been carried out in 2018. The annual budget was 1,155,528 USD, the expenditure was approximately 310,000 USD, leading to an annual delivery rate of 27%, and to an overall project delivery ratio of about 43%.
The main achievements obtained during the year can be summarised as follows:
First, 33 batches of capacity development workshops on various topics were held in the Jiangzhou District, 5 counties of Chongzuo and in Pingxiang City of Guangxi. Total admissions reach 2102 in 2018 and estimated to be more than 2450 in early 2019.
Second, the project continued to play the significant role in stimulating local agricultural mechanisation and providing agricultural machinery services. 4 tractors procured in 2017 kept working during all cropping seasons in 2018. During the sugar cane harvesting season at the end of 2018 and early 2019, 4 mowers and 17 balers will be working for agricultural residues collections tests in at least 16,700 mu of sugarcane fields.
Third, 1 delegation group of 5 delegates has been sent to Japan and Australia to competent authorities and enterprises abroad and learned expertise and know-how from countries with mature and developed biomass energy industry. Development of further partnership in the future is highly recommended for the sugar industry upgrading and biomass energy development in Guangxi. Cooperation would be considered to be established in the next stage of the project.
Fourth, the energy forests and grass plantation activities advanced smoothly in the selected demonstration sites.
Fifth, the comprehensive utilisation of biomass resources has been discussed in 2018 in order to further promote the biomass energy development and enhance the demonstration effects.
Sixth, the Mid-term Review has been conducted in 2018. With the Mid-term Review, the PMO has summarised the previous activities and project process. Problems have been well identified. The PMOs will review and refine the results-based management framework following the recommendations given by the Mid-term Review team for further implementation.
In addition, during the reporting course, adaptive management and inter-agency collaboration have been strengthened with local government departments and authorities at both municipal and provincial levels.
Throughout the year, certain results have been achieved, but the financial risk of the project had an extremely negative effect on the implementation. This would make passive influences for the partnership built in early stage, in particular sensitive questions, such as possibilities of the project implementation to the next stage, approaches taken for further conduction, budget availability, final payment to the arrears and subcontracts, etc. would potentially impact on the base of project implementation. Besides, other issues should be closely followed: till the end of 2018, large numbers of explorations on the utilisation of biomass resources have already been carried out in the early stage of the project, the suspension of the project might probably result in an incomplete chain of biomass utilisation, hence the output of the preliminary works could not be obtained. The fact would badly discourage key stakeholders and lead to a negative situation in the next stage of the project. A backup solution is required, especially for paying the arrears. In addition, in terms of project management, the unavailable funds brought instability for the management team. One project staff has left the team. Meanwhile, the decision-making and communication path of every unit was too long. Thus, it is suggested to improve the working mechanism. The financial control and reimbursement system need to be further optimised and clarified on the basis of considering the local real situation. The monitoring and evaluation mechanism and indicators also need to be clearly defined and adjusted according to the adjustment of the relevant activities.
Project satisfied the requirement of OAI audit and was closed per the discussion of UNDP and CICETE
Trying to get the project closure done prior to the Spring Festival.
